stories.title: You can do a lot with an empty file

stories.text:
I was approached by a couple of business guys back in december, they wanted to create a company. So I went along with it, created the software - but insisted on an agreement be made. This never happened, I ended up writing a lot of code, and no agreement was ever formulated.

I got sick of it, and bailed. Now they're telling me that I need to give them the code.

I live in Canada, and no idea how to reply. I donn't have resources or time to put towards this argument.

What should I do? Am I legally bound to send them the code?
stories.title: Ask HN: Corporate bully trying to take the code I wrote?

stories.text: I need a tool that can recursively scan a folder on a Mac and create a relational database (could be SQLite, postgres, mysql, etc) containing the file attributes for all the files and folders found.  I haven't seen any tool that does exactly this and was curious if the HN crowd knew of one.
stories.title: Ask HN: Tool for Mac, create database from filesystem
